BrightDusty is not the OP, therefore HeartVine's comments had absolutely nothing to do with the OP, who has not pposted their logs and therefore we cannot offer feedback.

There was already a long discussion about BrightDusty's logs when they made their own post, presumably at the time of their punishment.
Then lets change OP to "BrightDusty " that posted his Log. The concept would still apply.

There was discussion and clarification (by Gehirn) regarding BrightDusty's behaviour in the past (for his two week ban): https://boards.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-strategy/7AvNjzRj-2-week-ban?comment=0005

The same principles essentially hold true here. He clearly made no effort to improve his behaviour to the standards of the community (whatever the reason for that may have been) and since he had previously received his 2 week ban, his next punishment resulted in a permanent suspension.

There isn't really anything more to be said that hasn't already. When you enter a community you accept that the community will have a certain perspective on certain behaviours. Sometimes that perspective is explicitly stated, be it in a guild or in community guidelines for games the size of League or Overwatch, and sometimes they aren't, like in a friend group, but that perspective is always there.

If you disagree with the perspective of a community on x behaviour, then there's nothing wrong with that, but it's not up to you to decide, it's up to the community. If you had a friend who had been beaten to near death because he was gay, it would be understandably poor form to use homophobic slurs in a joking manner around that person, where in another of your friend circles it might be ok. 

Even if you disagree with the way League handles some behaviour, that at least should be something you can understand. Being a *huge* community, League has to find the best middle ground for the most people, and *most* people don't want to play with someone who is *consistently* and *constantly*, if not severely, negative for entire games.

Your belief seems to be that only severe behaviours should be punished, but the belief of a significant portion of the community is that anyone who is consistently souring the experience of players should also face consequences. There is even an argument for that behaviour being worse, depending on whether you think the number of games affected matters more than the severity of the breach of conduct.
